metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3839 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the XCF image rendering functionality of Simple DirectMedia Layer SDL2_image-2.0.2. A specially crafted XCF image can cause an out-of-bounds write on the heap, resulting in code execution. An attacker can display a specially crafted image to trigger this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.3+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.3+dfsg1-1').
sdl-image1.2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-8').
